&lt;p style=margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;Note 1 - Summary of Significant Accounting Policies&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;Organization and Nature of Business&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;iSatori Technologies, LLC (the&#13;&amp;#147;Predecessor Company&amp;#148;) was formed under the laws of the State of Colorado on June 14, 2004. On June 1, 2011, LS7 Products,&#13;LLC (d/b/a iSatori Global Technologies, LLC), a Colorado limited liability company and wholly owned subsidiary of the Predecessor&#13;Company (&amp;#147;LS7&amp;#148;), Eat-Smart, LLC a Colorado limited liability company and wholly owned subsidiary of the Predecessor&#13;Company (&amp;#147;Eat-Smart&amp;#148;), and Energize Solutions, LLC, a Colorado limited liability company and wholly owned subsidiary&#13;of the Predecessor Company (&amp;#147;Energize&amp;#148;), were merged with and into the Predecessor Company and Right Lane Publishing&#13;Inc., a Colorado subchapter S corporation and wholly owned subsidiary of the Predecessor Company (&amp;#147;Right Lane&amp;#148;), was&#13;distributed to Stephen Adele Enterprises, Inc., the Predecessor Company&amp;#146;s sole shareholder (collectively, the &amp;#147;Reorganizations&amp;#148;).&#13;On June 1, 2011, after consummation of the Reorganizations, the Predecessor Company converted to a corporation pursuant to the&#13;laws of the State of Colorado changing its name to iSatori Technologies, Inc. (&amp;#147;iSatori Technologies&amp;#148;).&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;On April 5, 2012, iSatori Acquisition&#13;Corp. (&amp;#147;Merger Sub&amp;#148;), a Delaware corporation and wholly-owned subsidiary of Integrated Security Systems, Inc (&amp;#147;Integrated&amp;#148;),&#13;consummated a merger (the &amp;#147;Merger&amp;#148;) with iSatori Technologies, pursuant to a Merger Agreement, dated as of February&#13;17, 2012, by and among Integrated, Merger Sub and iSatori Technologies (the &amp;#147;Merger Agreement&amp;#148;). Pursuant to the Merger&#13;Agreement, iSatori Technologies was merged with and into Merger Sub with iSatori Technologies surviving as a wholly-owned subsidiary&#13;of Integrated.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Upon completion of the Merger,&#13;the holders of iSatori Technologies&amp;#146; common stock, and holders of equity instruments convertible into shares of iSatori&#13;Technologies&amp;#146; common stock, received an aggregate of approximately 8,410,973 shares of Integrated common stock.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;On June 29, 2012, Integrated&#13;completed a &amp;#147;short form&amp;#148; merger under &amp;#167;253 of the Delaware General Corporation Law pursuant to which iSatori&#13;Technologies was merged with and into Integrated with Integrated continuing as the surviving corporation. In connection with the&#13;Merger, Integrated changed its name to iSatori, Inc. The trading symbol of the Company on OTCBB is &amp;#147;IFIT&amp;#148;.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Prior to the Merger, Integrated&#13;was a company with virtually no operations. The Merger was accounted for as the equivalent to the issuance of stock by iSatori&#13;Technologies for the net monetary assets of Integrated. The accompanying financial statements therefore include the consolidated&#13;results of operations of iSatori Technologies and Intergrated for periods subsequent to the Merger, and iSatori Technologies only&#13;for periods prior to the Merger. References to the financial operations of iSatori Technologies and the Predecessor Company are&#13;noted for the respective reporting periods as noted above. Unless otherwise specifically indicated, references to the &amp;#147;Company&amp;#148;&#13;(without further qualification) necessarily include iSatori Technologies, the Predecessor Company, Integrated and iSatori, Inc.&#13;for all applicable accounting periods. Since there was no change in the ownership of the business in connection with the Reorganizations,&#13;the assets and the liabilities of the Predecessor Company have been recorded on iSatori Technologies&amp;#146; financial statements&#13;at the same amounts at which they were reported on the financial statements of the Predecessor Company. All transactions between&#13;divisions and/or wholly owned subsidiaries of iSatori Technologies or the Predecessor Company have been eliminated in the financial&#13;statements. In addition, per the operating agreement of the Predecessor Company, no member was to have been liable for the debts,&#13;liabilities or obligations of the Predecessor Company.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;The Company is engaged in researching,&#13;designing, developing, contracting for the manufacture, marketing, selling and distributing of various nutritional and dietary&#13;supplement products for the general nutrition market. The &amp;#147;general nutrition market&amp;#148; may include such activities as&#13;body-building, physique enhancement (increase of lean body mass and decrease in fat mass) and enhanced athletic performance through&#13;increased strength and/or endurance and proper nutrition.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;The Company does engage from&#13;time to time in funding of clinical studies with the objective of discovering and/or validating claims of new, efficacious products&#13;for the Company&amp;#146;s relevant market as well as providing necessary and appropriate substantiation for any claims which the&#13;Company may use in its marketing and advertising. The Company markets products which are under its control and which are in some&#13;way proprietary to the Company. Some of the Company&amp;#146;s products are the subject of trademarks owned by the Company.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;The accompanying consolidated&#13;financial statements include the accounts of the Company and the Predecessor Company: LS7; Right Lane; Eat-Smart; Energize; and&#13;Integrated for the respective reporting periods described above.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;Basis of Presentation/Basis of Consolidation&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;The accompanying consolidated&#13;financial statements have been prepared on an accrual basis of accounting in accordance with Generally Accepted Accounting Principles&#13;in the United States (&amp;#147;GAAP&amp;#148;). The accompanying consolidated financial statements present the financial position and&#13;results of operations of the Company and include the amounts of the Company as well as the Predecessor Company and all wholly&#13;owned subsidiaries. Accordingly, all significant intercompany transactions have been eliminated.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Certain amounts in the 2012 consolidated&#13;financial statements have been reclassified to conform to the 2013 presentation. Such reclassifications include moving Coupon&#13;expense from Selling and marketing expense to Product revenue (net of returns and discounts) and moving the income (expense) in&#13;the Change in the value of derivative instruments from Financing expense to Other income (expense) on the consolidated statement&#13;of operations. On the consolidated balance sheet, Debt issuance costs and Deferred Offering costs have been consolidated into&#13;Deposits and other assets. These had no effect on net income.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;Financial Instruments&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;The Company considers all highly&#13;liquid debt instruments purchased with an original maturity of three months or less to be cash equivalents. Accordingly, cash&#13;and cash equivalents consist of petty cash, checking accounts and money market funds.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;As of December 31, 2012, the&#13;Company invested approximately $966 thousand with Horter Financial Group which, acted as investment advisor with and into the&#13;Alpha/Pimco Bonds Plus Total Return Fund.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;The underlying security matures&#13;in three years. However, the Company has access and can liquidate the underlying security on 72-hours&amp;#146; notice. Thus, it&#13;has been classified as a current asset. The investment strategy involves an investment in three separate &amp;#147;power periods&amp;#148;,&#13;late October, late November and late December of each year.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;The Company invested $960 thousand&#13;in this fund. As of December 31, 2012, the Company realized a net asset value gain of approximately $6 thousand. The total portfolio&#13;of the Company had a stated value therefore of $966 thousand. This investment account was closed on February 22, 2013. The Company&#13;realized an additional $7 thousand in net asset value gain up to the time the account was closed.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;At December 31, 2013 and December&#13;31, 2012, the financial instruments of the Company consisted principally of cash and cash equivalents, investments, receivables,&#13;accounts payable, certain accrued liabilities and long-term debt. The carrying amount of cash and cash equivalents, receivables,&#13;accounts payable and accrued liabilities approximates their fair value because of the short maturity of these instruments. The&#13;actual and estimated fair values, respectively, of the Company&amp;#146;s financial instruments are as follows:&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=margin: 0&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 style=width: 100%; margin-top: 0px; font-size: 9pt&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=font-size: 1pt&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=width: 58%&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times

 Serif&gt;701,852&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;p style=margin: 0&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;Trade Receivables and Credit Policy&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Trade receivables are uncollateralized&#13;customer obligations due under normal trade terms requiring payment generally within 10-60 days from the invoice date. Accounts&#13;are considered delinquent when outstanding for more than seven days past due date. The Company does not have a policy of accruing&#13;interest on past due accounts. Payments on trade receivables are applied as instructed per the customer, or to the earliest unpaid&#13;invoices. The allowance for doubtful accounts represents an estimate of amounts considered uncollectible and is determined based&#13;on management&amp;#146;s historical collection experience, adverse situations that may affect the customer&amp;#146;s ability to repay,&#13;and prevailing economic conditions. Specific accounts deemed uncollectible are written off periodically with subsequent receipts&#13;on previously written off accounts credited to bad debt expense. The allowance for doubtful accounts is $0 for each of the periods&#13;ended December 31, 2013 and December 31, 2012. Receivables at each of the below respective periods consisted of the following:&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 style=width: 100%; margin-top: 0px; font-size: 9pt&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=font-size: 1pt&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=width: 61%&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=width: 2%&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=width: 16%&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=width: 2%&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=width: 2%&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=width: 17%&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=vertical-align: bottom&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td colspan=2 style=border-bottom: #000000 1px solid; vertical-align: top&gt;&lt;p style=font-size: 8.5pt; text-align: center; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;December&#13;                                         31,&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;        &lt;p style=font-size: 8.5pt; text-align: center; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;2013&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=vertical-align: top; font-size: 8.5pt&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman

 Serif&gt;In addition, the Company has recorded an allowance&#13;for customer returns in the amount of approximately $70,000 at December 31, 2013 and $68,000 at December 31, 2012 in accrued expenses.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman

 Serif&gt;Inventories of nutritional and&#13;dietary supplements are stated at lower of cost or market on a first-in, first-out (FIFO) basis as noted below:&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman

 Serif&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=border-bottom: #000000 3px double; vertical-align: top; text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;1,292,105&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;p style=margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;Notes Receivable&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;The Predecessor Company disposed&#13;of a dormant product line of vitamins in December 2010. As part of the consideration in this divestiture, the Company received&#13;from the purchaser of this product line an unsecured note in the amount of $170,000. The original note was due to be repaid on&#13;or before March 2014, where interest accrued principally at an annual rate of 5%, based upon the initial $170,000 principal and&#13;was payable monthly. As of March 31, 2013, the note was novated and a new promissory note was issued to reflect a modification&#13;in the payment terms, which includes no interest. The total amount to be repaid is the open principal amount of $118,608 at December&#13;31, 2013 with $0 interest, and is due to be repaid on or before May 1, 2017. An allowance in the amount of $25,881 has been recorded&#13;against the aforementioned balance.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;Property and Equipment&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Property and equipment are stated&#13;at cost. Depreciation for financial accounting purposes is computed using the straight-line method over the estimated lives of&#13;the respective assets, ranging from three to ten years. Maintenance and repairs are charged to expense when incurred. When property&#13;and equipment are retired or otherwise disposed of, the related cost and accumulated depreciation are thereafter removed from&#13;the respective accounts and any gain or loss is credited or charged to income. Total depreciation expense was $83,450 and $76,266&#13;for the years ended December 31, 2013 and 2012, respectively.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;Other Assets and Intangible&#13;Assets&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Other assets include intangible&#13;assets which are principally direct television advertising, websites, as well as deposits and are included in Deposits and other&#13;Assets. The Company periodically performs reviews of other assets including amortizable intangible and depreciable tangible assets,&#13;for impairment purposes using undiscounted cash flow methodology. Factors considered important that may trigger an impairment&#13;of assets review include, but are not necessarily limited to: significant changes in the manner of the use of its assets involving&#13;its strategy for its overall business; significant negative industry or economic trends; or underperforming business trends. These&#13;reviews may include an analysis of the Company&amp;#146;s current operations and capacity utilization in conjunction with an analysis&#13;of the markets in which the Company&amp;#146;s business is operating.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Intangible assets are discussed&#13;below. Amortization for financial accounting purposes is computed using the straight-line method over the estimated useful lives&#13;of the respective assets which range from three to ten years. Amortization for 2013 and 2012 totaled $11,698 and $3,259, respectively.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=margin: 0&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 style=width: 100%; margin-top: 0px; font-size: 9pt&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=font-size: 1pt&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=width: 59%&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=width: 1%&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=width: 19%&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=width: 1%&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=width: 1%&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=width: 19%&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=vertical-align: bottom&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman

 Serif&gt;(120,179)&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=background-color: #f3f3f3&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=vertical-align: bottom; text-indent: 8px&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman

 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;TOTAL&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=border-bottom: #000000 3px double; vertical-align: bottom&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=border-bottom: #000000 3px double; vertical-align: top; text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;26,706&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=vertical-align: bottom&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman

 Times
 Serif&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=border-bottom: #000000 3px double; vertical-align: top; text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;30,854&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;p style=margin: 0&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 style=width: 100%; margin-top: 0px; font-size: 9pt&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=font-size: 1pt&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=width: 90%&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman

 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=vertical-align: bottom&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;Future Amortization for the years&#13;    ending December 31:&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=vertical-align: top&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=vertical-align: bottom&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=vertical-align: bottom&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=vertical-align: top&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman

 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=vertical-align: bottom&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman

 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=background-color: #f3f3f3&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=vertical-align: bottom&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;2014&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=vertical-align: top&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=vertical-align: bottom; text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;12,800&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=vertical-align: bottom&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;2015&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=vertical-align: top&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=vertical-align: bottom; text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;12,785&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=background-color: #f3f3f3&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=vertical-align: bottom&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;2016&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=vertical-align: top&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=vertical-align: bottom; text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;1,121&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;p style=margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;Revenue Recognition&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;The Company operates predominantly&#13;as a distributor of its dietary supplement products through traditional large retailers and electronic intermediaries. Revenue&#13;from product sales is recognized upon transfer of title of the Company&amp;#146;s product to its customers. Net sales represent product&#13;sales less actual returns, allowances, discounts, and promotions. Sales to direct customers have an unconditional money back guarantee&#13;for thirty to sixty days after the date of purchase. Sales to several of the retail customers carry a &amp;#147;Sale or Return&amp;#148;&#13;Purchase agreement per contract, where if minimum sales thresholds are not met within required timeframe, the inventory will be&#13;returned to the Company for full credit. Other retail customers receive a percentage discount from invoice to cover any customer&#13;returns or damages they may incur. Returns, allowances and discounts, and coupons were $2,114,060 and $1,761,203 for the years&#13;ending December 31, 2013 and 2012, respectively.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;In addition, the Company provides&#13;allowances for sales returns based upon estimated and known returns. Product returns are recorded as a reduction of net revenues&#13;and as a reduction of the accounts receivable balance.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;The Company receives other revenues&#13;which includes but is not limited to shipping and handling charges which is charged to customers.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;Cost of Sales&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;The Company purchases its products&#13;directly from third party manufacturers. The Company&amp;#146;s cost of sales include product costs, cost of warehousing and distribution.&#13;Included in the cost of sales are shipping and handling costs that are incurred by the Company.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;Income Taxes&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;The Company utilizes the asset&#13;and liability method of accounting for income taxes. Under this asset and liability method, deferred tax assets and liabilities&#13;are recognized for the estimated future tax consequences attributable to differences between the financial statements carrying&#13;amounts of existing assets and liabilities, and their respective tax bases. Deferred tax assets and liabilities are measured using&#13;enacted tax rates in effect for the year in which those temporary differences are expected to be recovered or settled. See Note&#13;7, &amp;#147;Income Taxes&amp;#148;. For the year ended December 31, 2011 and future years, the Company will file a consolidated federal&#13;income tax return. For state income tax purposes, the Company will also file a consolidated return in the states requiring the&#13;filing of such returns.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;The Company has adopted the provisions&#13;of Codification Topic 740-10, &amp;#147;Accounting for Income Taxes,&amp;#148; (previously Financial Interpretation No. 48, &amp;#147;Accounting&#13;for Uncertainty in Income Taxes&amp;#148;), as of June 1, 2011. The implementation of this standard had no impact on the financial&#13;statements.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Furthermore, since 2011 was the&#13;Company&amp;#146;s initial tax year, there are no prior federal or state tax returns subject to examination. Accordingly, the only&#13;taxable periods subject to examination by federal and state taxing authorities is the period ended December 31, 2012 and 2011.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;Leases&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;The Company leases its headquarters&#13;facility, comprising approximately 10,044 square feet, in Golden (metropolitan Denver), Colorado. The total rent expense for the&#13;year ended December 31, 2013 was $82,863 and $57,108 for 2012. The lease expired on September, 30, 2012, and a new lease was signed&#13;on November 1, 2012 for a term of four years and three months, which included the expansion of the lease space from the original&#13;7,120 to a total of 10,044 square feet to accommodate growth. The Company assumed the new addition in February of 2013. Future&#13;payments under the newly signed lease are $255,494. The Company also leases miscellaneous office and warehouse equipment. In most&#13;cases, management expects that in the normal course of business these leases will be renewed or replaced by other leases as applicable.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;i&gt;Future Payments&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 style=margin-top: 0px; font-size: 9pt; width: 100%&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=font-size: 1pt&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=width: 39%&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=width: 36%&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=width: 3%&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=width: 22%&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=background-color: #f3f3f3; vertical-align: bottom; text-align: center&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;2014&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=background-color: #f3f3f3; vertical-align: bottom&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=background-color: #f3f3f3; vertical-align: bottom; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=background-color: #f3f3f3; vertical-align: bottom; text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;82,863&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=vertical-align: bottom&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: center&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;2015&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;82,863&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=vertical-align: bottom; background-color: #f3f3f3&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: center&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;2016&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;82,863&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=vertical-align: bottom&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: center&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;2017&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=border-bottom: #000000 1px solid; text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=border-bottom: #000000 1px solid; text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;6,905&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=vertical-align: bottom; background-color: #f3f3f3&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: center&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Total&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: justify&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=text-align: right&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;255,494&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;Fair Value Measurements&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;ASC 820-10 establishes a framework&#13;for measuring the fair value of assets and liabilities and requires additional disclosure about fair value measurements. ASC 820-10&#13;defines fair value as the price that would be received to sell an asset or paid to transfer a liability in the principal (or most&#13;advantageous market) for the asset or liability in than orderly transaction between market participants at the measure date.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;The Company has a number of financial&#13;instruments, including cash, receivables, inventory, payables and debt obligations. The Company has issued warrants which are&#13;measured at fair value on a recurring basis. The Company estimates that the fair value of these financial instruments does not&#13;materially differ from the respective reported balance sheet amounts.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;Marketing&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;The Company expenses all production&#13;costs related to advertising costs as they are incurred, including print and television when the advertisement has been broadcast&#13;or otherwise distributed. The Company records website costs related to its direct-to-consumer advertisements in accordance with&#13;FASB ASC 340-20 &amp;#147;Capitalized Advertising Costs&amp;#148;. In accordance with FASB ASC 340-20, direct response advertising costs&#13;incurred should be reported as assets and should be amortized over the estimated period of the benefits, based on the proportion&#13;of current period revenue from the advertisements to probable future revenue. As of December 31, 2013 and December 31, 2012, the&#13;Company had deferred $7,651 and $3,641 respectively, related to such advertising costs. This amount is included in Deposits and&#13;other assets and is being amortized over a one year period. Total Marketing expenses for the years ended December 31, 2013 and&#13;2012, totaled $2,232,548 and $1,952,333, respectively.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=margin: 0&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;Research and Development Costs&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Research and development costs&#13;are expensed when incurred. Research and development costs of $162,297 and $37,234 for December 31, 2013 and 2012, respectively,&#13;are included in selling and marketing expense.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;Distribution, Shipping and&#13;Handling Costs&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Shipping costs on purchases and&#13;shipping and handling fees related to sales charged to customers are both included in cost of sales. As mentioned in Revenue Recognition,&#13;shipping and handling revenue billed customers are reflected in other revenues.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;Concentration of Credit Risk&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Financial instruments that potentially&#13;subject the Company to concentration of credit risk consist principally of temporary cash investments and trade accounts receivables.&#13;Concentrations of credit with respect to trade receivables are limited due to the large number of customers comprising the Company&amp;#146;s&#13;customer bases and their dispersion across different geographic locations.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;The Company maintains cash balances&#13;at one financial institution located in Colorado and one in California. Accounts at these institutions are insured by the Federal&#13;Deposit Insurance Corporation (FDIC) up to $250,000 per account. At times during the year, the Company&amp;#146;s bank balances have&#13;exceeded the FDIC limit. Management believes the risk of loss at such institutions to be minimal.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Customers whose revenue balance exceeds 10% of the&#13;account balance are disclosed below with corresponding accounts receivable balance outstanding at year end:&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=margin: 0&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 style=width: 100%; margin-top: 0px; font-size: 9pt&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=font-size: 1pt&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=width: 32%&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times

 Serif&gt;0%&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;p style=margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;Use of Estimates&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;The preparation of the financial&#13;statements in conformity with accounting principles generally accepted in the United States of America requires management to&#13;make estimates and assumptions that affect the reported amounts of assets and liabilities at the date of the financial statements&#13;and the reported amounts of revenues and expenses during the reporting period. Actual results could differ from those estimates.&#13;Significant estimates include but are not limited to the fair value determination of derivative instruments, NOL allowance, sales&#13;returns allowance and allowance for notes receivable.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;Earnings (Loss) Per Share&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Net earnings (loss) per share&#13;is computed by dividing net income (loss) less preferred dividends for the period by the weighted average number of common stock&#13;outstanding during each period. Diluted earnings (loss) per share is computed by dividing net income (loss) less preferred dividends&#13;for the period by the weighted average number of common stock, common stock equivalents and potentially dilutive securities outstanding&#13;during each period.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Since the Company reflected a&#13;net loss for the years ended December 31, 2013 and 2012, the effect of considering any common stock equivalents, if exercisable,&#13;would have been anti-dilutive. A separate computation of diluted earnings (loss) per share is not presented.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;The Company has the following&#13;common stock equivalents as of December 31, 2013 and December 31, 2012:&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=margin: 0&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;table cellspacing=0 cellpadding=0 style=width: 100%; margin-top: 0px; font-size: 9pt&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=font-size: 1pt&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=width: 71%&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=width: 3%&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=width: 13%&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=width: 1%&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times

 Times

 Times

 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;2013&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td style=vertical-align: bottom; font-size: 8.5pt&gt;&lt;font style=font: 8pt Times New Roman
 Times

 Times

 Serif&gt;1,103,276&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;tr style=vertical-align: bottom; background-color: #ffffff&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Warrants (exercise price &amp;#150; $0.001-$0.57/share)&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&#13;    &lt;td&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman

 Serif&gt;14,303,545&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/td&gt;&lt;/tr&gt;&#13;&lt;/table&gt;&#13;&lt;p style=margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman

 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;Recent Accounting Pronouncements&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;Organization and Nature of Business&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;iSatori Technologies, LLC (the&#13;&amp;#147;Predecessor Company&amp;#148;) was formed under the laws of the State of Colorado on June 14, 2004. On June 1, 2011, LS7 Products,&#13;LLC (d/b/a iSatori Global Technologies, LLC), a Colorado limited liability company and wholly owned subsidiary of the Predecessor&#13;Company (&amp;#147;LS7&amp;#148;), Eat-Smart, LLC a Colorado limited liability company and wholly owned subsidiary of the Predecessor&#13;Company (&amp;#147;Eat-Smart&amp;#148;), and Energize Solutions, LLC, a Colorado limited liability company and wholly owned subsidiary&#13;of the Predecessor Company (&amp;#147;Energize&amp;#148;), were merged with and into the Predecessor Company and Right Lane Publishing&#13;Inc., a Colorado subchapter S corporation and wholly owned subsidiary of the Predecessor Company (&amp;#147;Right Lane&amp;#148;), was&#13;distributed to Stephen Adele Enterprises, Inc., the Predecessor Company&amp;#146;s sole shareholder (collectively, the &amp;#147;Reorganizations&amp;#148;).&#13;On June 1, 2011, after consummation of the Reorganizations, the Predecessor Company converted to a corporation pursuant to the&#13;laws of the State of Colorado changing its name to iSatori Technologies, Inc. (&amp;#147;iSatori Technologies&amp;#148;).&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;On April 5, 2012, iSatori Acquisition&#13;Corp. (&amp;#147;Merger Sub&amp;#148;), a Delaware corporation and wholly-owned subsidiary of Integrated Security Systems, Inc (&amp;#147;Integrated&amp;#148;),&#13;consummated a merger (the &amp;#147;Merger&amp;#148;) with iSatori Technologies, pursuant to a Merger Agreement, dated as of February&#13;17, 2012, by and among Integrated, Merger Sub and iSatori Technologies (the &amp;#147;Merger Agreement&amp;#148;). Pursuant to the Merger&#13;Agreement, iSatori Technologies was merged with and into Merger Sub with iSatori Technologies surviving as a wholly-owned subsidiary&#13;of Integrated.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Upon completion of the Merger,&#13;the holders of iSatori Technologies&amp;#146; common stock, and holders of equity instruments convertible into shares of iSatori&#13;Technologies&amp;#146; common stock, received an aggregate of approximately 8,410,973 shares of Integrated common stock.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;On June 29, 2012, Integrated&#13;completed a &amp;#147;short form&amp;#148; merger under &amp;#167;253 of the Delaware General Corporation Law pursuant to which iSatori&#13;Technologies was merged with and into Integrated with Integrated continuing as the surviving corporation. In connection with the&#13;Merger, Integrated changed its name to iSatori, Inc. The trading symbol of the Company on OTCBB is &amp;#147;IFIT&amp;#148;.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Prior to the Merger, Integrated&#13;was a company with virtually no operations. The Merger was accounted for as the equivalent to the issuance of stock by iSatori&#13;Technologies for the net monetary assets of Integrated. The accompanying financial statements therefore include the consolidated&#13;results of operations of iSatori Technologies and Intergrated for periods subsequent to the Merger, and iSatori Technologies only&#13;for periods prior to the Merger. References to the financial operations of iSatori Technologies and the Predecessor Company are&#13;noted for the respective reporting periods as noted above. Unless otherwise specifically indicated, references to the &amp;#147;Company&amp;#148;&#13;(without further qualification) necessarily include iSatori Technologies, the Predecessor Company, Integrated and iSatori, Inc.&#13;for all applicable accounting periods. Since there was no change in the ownership of the business in connection with the Reorganizations,&#13;the assets and the liabilities of the Predecessor Company have been recorded on iSatori Technologies&amp;#146; financial statements&#13;at the same amounts at which they were reported on the financial statements of the Predecessor Company. All transactions between&#13;divisions and/or wholly owned subsidiaries of iSatori Technologies or the Predecessor Company have been eliminated in the financial&#13;statements. In addition, per the operating agreement of the Predecessor Company, no member was to have been liable for the debts,&#13;liabilities or obligations of the Predecessor Company.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;The Company is engaged in researching,&#13;designing, developing, contracting for the manufacture, marketing, selling and distributing of various nutritional and dietary&#13;supplement products for the general nutrition market. The &amp;#147;general nutrition market&amp;#148; may include such activities as&#13;body-building, physique enhancement (increase of lean body mass and decrease in fat mass) and enhanced athletic performance through&#13;increased strength and/or endurance and proper nutrition.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;The Company does engage from&#13;time to time in funding of clinical studies with the objective of discovering and/or validating claims of new, efficacious products&#13;for the Company&amp;#146;s relevant market as well as providing necessary and appropriate substantiation for any claims which the&#13;Company may use in its marketing and advertising. The Company markets products which are under its control and which are in some&#13;way proprietary to the Company. Some of the Company&amp;#146;s products are the subject of trademarks owned by the Company.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;Basis of Presentation/Basis of Consolidation&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;The accompanying consolidated&#13;financial statements have been prepared on an accrual basis of accounting in accordance with Generally Accepted Accounting Principles&#13;in the United States (&amp;#147;GAAP&amp;#148;). The accompanying consolidated financial statements present the financial position and&#13;results of operations of the Company and include the amounts of the Company as well as the Predecessor Company and all wholly&#13;owned subsidiaries. Accordingly, all significant intercompany transactions have been eliminated.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;Financial Instruments&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;The Company considers all highly&#13;liquid debt instruments purchased with an original maturity of three months or less to be cash equivalents. Accordingly, cash&#13;and cash equivalents consist of petty cash, checking accounts and money market funds.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;Trade Receivables and Credit Policy&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;Inventory Valuation&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;Property and Equipment&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;Other Assets and Intangible&#13;Assets&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Other assets include intangible&#13;assets which are principally direct television advertising, websites, as well as deposits and are included in Deposits and other&#13;Assets. The Company periodically performs reviews of other assets including amortizable intangible and depreciable tangible assets,&#13;for impairment purposes using undiscounted cash flow methodology. Factors considered important that may trigger an impairment&#13;of assets review include, but are not necessarily limited to: significant changes in the manner of the use of its assets involving&#13;its strategy for its overall business; significant negative industry or economic trends; or underperforming business trends. These&#13;reviews may include an analysis of the Company&amp;#146;s current operations and capacity utilization in conjunction with an analysis&#13;of the markets in which the Company&amp;#146;s business is operating.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;Revenue Recognition&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;The Company operates predominantly&#13;as a distributor of its dietary supplement products through traditional large retailers and electronic intermediaries. Revenue&#13;from product sales is recognized upon transfer of title of the Company&amp;#146;s product to its customers. Net sales represent product&#13;sales less actual returns, allowances, discounts, and promotions. Sales to direct customers have an unconditional money back guarantee&#13;for thirty to sixty days after the date of purchase. Sales to several of the retail customers carry a &amp;#147;Sale or Return&amp;#148;&#13;Purchase agreement per contract, where if minimum sales thresholds are not met within required timeframe, the inventory will be&#13;returned to the Company for full credit. Other retail customers receive a percentage discount from invoice to cover any customer&#13;returns or damages they may incur.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;In addition, the Company provides&#13;allowances for sales returns based upon estimated and known returns. Product returns are recorded as a reduction of net revenues&#13;and as a reduction of the accounts receivable balance.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;Cost of Sales&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;Income Taxes&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;The Company utilizes the asset&#13;and liability method of accounting for income taxes. Under this asset and liability method, deferred tax assets and liabilities&#13;are recognized for the estimated future tax consequences attributable to differences between the financial statements carrying&#13;amounts of existing assets and liabilities, and their respective tax bases. Deferred tax assets and liabilities are measured using&#13;enacted tax rates in effect for the year in which those temporary differences are expected to be recovered or settled.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;The Company has adopted the provisions&#13;of Codification Topic 740-10, &amp;#147;Accounting for Income Taxes,&amp;#148; (previously Financial Interpretation No. 48, &amp;#147;Accounting&#13;for Uncertainty in Income Taxes&amp;#148;), as of June 1, 2011. The implementation of this standard had no impact on the financial&#13;statements.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;Fair Value Measurements&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;ASC 820-10 establishes a framework&#13;for measuring the fair value of assets and liabilities and requires additional disclosure about fair value measurements. ASC 820-10&#13;defines fair value as the price that would be received to sell an asset or paid to transfer a liability in the principal (or most&#13;advantageous market) for the asset or liability in than orderly transaction between market participants at the measure date.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;Marketing&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times

 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;Distribution, Shipping and&#13;Handling Costs&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman

 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;Concentration of Credit Risk&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Financial instruments that potentially&#13;subject the Company to concentration of credit risk consist principally of temporary cash investments and trade accounts receivables.&#13;Concentrations of credit with respect to trade receivables are limited due to the large number of customers comprising the Company&amp;#146;s&#13;customer bases and their dispersion across different geographic locations.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;Use of Estimates&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;Earnings (Loss) Per Share&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;Net earnings (loss) per share&#13;is computed by dividing net income (loss) less preferred dividends for the period by the weighted average number of common stock&#13;outstanding during each period. Diluted earnings (loss) per share is computed by dividing net income (loss) less preferred dividends&#13;for the period by the weighted average number of common stock, common stock equivalents and potentially dilutive securities outstanding&#13;during each period.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times

 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;u&gt;Note 2 - Endorsement / Spokesperson&#13;/ Consulting Agreements&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;The Company is obligated under&#13;various endorsement, spokesperson and consulting agreements with varying original terms ranging from one to three years. These&#13;endorsers, spokespersons and consultants are generally paid a monthly fee for their services, including promotion and marketing&#13;activities per the agreements. All of these agreements may be terminated by either party upon breach or default in the terms of&#13;the agreements. The Company expensed $161,950 and $232,248 under these agreements in 2013 and 2012, respectively.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=text-align: justify; margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
&lt;p style=margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
 Times
 Serif&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;u&gt;Note 3 - Retirement Plan&lt;/u&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;&#13;&#13;&lt;p style=margin: 0&gt;&lt;font style=font: 10pt Times New Roman
